Message.Title: "Thinking Different"
Message.Msg: By thinkdifferent_98 . 14 years 8 months ago . Permalink Just a few questions: 1) In December, the AAPL volume has been quite high ~2m on the average, as compared to previous .5m averages, why? 2) Adobe's reports that their sales based on Mac's were quite low and that most of their growth was based on Windows products ( please see the latest adobe quarterly report ), the report before that had reported brisk sales as a result of Mac OS8, but AAPL sales for previous q. was miserable, how do we interpret Adobe's report in terms of AAPL's forthcoming report 3) Do you think the 400m expenditure to acquire Next was a smart move, would it have been better to pool interest with Sun, and build friendly interfaces to Solaris, while at the same time make a few sales porting Solaris to x86 with the Mac interface, ( noone is exploiting this market now), this would give them time to port to x86 with Rapshidy (sp), also they would have priorities and certain insights into Java. Please recall Scott McNeally and 386i, a brilliant move, can't apple borrow a chapter or two from Scott? 4)A catch all strategy, merge AAPL, Oracle, Netscape, Sun, Silicon Graphics, to take MSTF head-on, else, they'll all individually perish ! notwithstanding anti-trust, do you think this strategy would be better than individual companies going it alone? 5) Think different, is this a non-mainstream message? and is this where AAPL want to be heading?

Message.Title: Independent Voter Surge Cuts Democrats Edge in Swing States
Message.Msg: Independent voters are growing in numbers at the expense of Democrats in battleground states most likely to determine this year’s presidential election, a Bloomberg News analysis shows. The collective total of independents grew by about 443,000 in Colorado, Florida, Iowa, Nevada, New Hampshire and North Carolina since the 2008 election, according to data compiled by Bloomberg from state election officials. During the same time, Democrats saw a net decline of about 480,000 in those six states, while Republicans added roughly 38,000 voters in them, the analysis shows.

Do you really think Romney excites core Republicans and conservatives the way Reagan did? Romney twists on everything - he wants to be all things to all people. Message.Msg: LOL well ok here are more tea leaves. $620 is a small resistance point. We should bang against it 2-4 times before flying to $640 which is a major resistance point. Oh there are many professional charters. You see them on CNBC all the time. Many of the larger houses use them. No I'm not one of them but to laugh at them now is kind of like saying we never landed on the moon it was all Hollywood tricks. No its not a science, its wrong many times. I've lost money using them but I've made more. There are many charters on all sites who are not charters. They kind of learn the language and try to manipulate sentiment in there direction so after awhile who can trust what they read here. So laugh at it until you find someone who find to be 70-80% accurate. Then just take in in like any other news.

Message.Title: Obama Alienates Democrats With Tax Hike Proposal
Message.Msg: President Barack Obama’s renewed call to eliminate the Bush era tax cuts for anyone with annual income of more than $250,000 is making him a lot of enemies in his own party. That’s particularly the case among Democrats facing competitive congressional races, Politico reports. Many of them would prefer that the threshold be set at $1 million rather than $250,000, and some would like to see the tax decreases, scheduled to expire Dec. 31, continue for everyone. This rebellion represents a continuation of the trend of moderate Democrats fleeing from the president. Florida Sen. Bill Nelson, who’s running for re-election this year, prefers the $1 million limit, according to his office. North Dakota Senate candidate Heidi Heitkamp feels the same way. And Former Nebraska Sen. Bob Kerrey, who seeks to reclaim his old seat, “believes the $250,000 limit is too low but is evaluating how specific proposals would affect the budget,” his campaign spokesman said. The split shows up on other issues as well. Several vulnerable Democrats will probably support repealing the healthcare reform law when a vote is held on the issue Wednesday. Democrats representing states with large coal operations have taken Obama to task on energy policy. And some Democrats in hotly-contested races are staying away from the presidential convention in September to avoid being tainted by an association with Obama.

Message.Title: "Hallelujah, hallelujah, Obamacare is officially
Message.Msg: the law of the land," proclaim liberals across the country. President Obama has waved his magic wand, and suddenly everybody will have the best health care in the world and at almost no cost. Liberal pundits and politicians are gushing as if the president were truly their messiah and Obamacare were written on stone tablets — albeit 2,700 stone tablets. Some have even blathered about their new love for Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts. The softness of the liberals' hearts can only be topped by the softness of their brains. Liberals, bless their hearts, have blindly bought into the president's fantasy. In fact, when challenged, they simply call you a racist and recite the president's talking points that everyone is covered, if you like your doctor you can keep him, people with pre-existing conditions can't be turned down, kids can stay on their parents insurance until they are 26, blah, blah, blah. For some strange reason, when Nancy Pelosi said in 2010, "We have to pass the bill so you can find out what is in it," liberals never took the initiative during the past two years to actually see what was in the bill. To this day, most Americans don't know how Obamacare will be implemented or how it will directly affect them. Mainstream media outlets have never examined any real-world scenarios, the real-world costs and who will actually foot the bill for this monstrous law. Let's take a look at a couple of typical examples. Tom and Katie are 25-year-old newlyweds who currently only carry a catastrophic policy because they are in good health and can afford to pay as they go for routine doctor visits. Under Obamacare, this young couple will now be forced to purchase a health insurance policy that the government mandates as suitable, which means a significant increase in their premiums. They may have been saving for a new house, a vacation or a new car, or they may have been saving for a baby — but now their extra money will be taken by the IRS in order to pay for a policy they didn't want or need. If this couple fails to comply, they will face a financial penalty. Uh, wait, the Supreme Court said it was a tax; but wait, President Obama says it's not a tax ... no matter what it's called, it's still money out of their pockets. On a hypocritical side note: Liberals hate government intrusion into their lives, especially when it comes from a conservative — i.e., abortion or the Pledge of Allegiance. Yet Obamacare will force millions of Americans to alter their lifestyles in order to buy government-mandated health insurance. Now take a business owner who has 50 employees. The economy is tough, and currently that owner may not be able to afford health insurance for his employees. Because of Obamacare, he will be forced to either buy a government dictated plan or pay a $2,000 fine, uh, tax, no, I mean penalty (which is it again?) per employee. For you libs out there who can't do math, that comes to $100,000 per year that business owner will fork over to the government because of Obamacare. Guess what? The owner will have to raise prices, and the employees still won't have health insurance. What a great system. Next , I will help liberals by dispelling other fantasies such as the tooth fairy, gnomes and Santa Claus, who they believe lives in Washington.

Message.Title: UK High Court: Samsung Tablets Don't Infringe Apple Design!Another ABSURD Lawsuit THROWN OUT by Court
Message.Msg: English High Court: Samsung Tablets Don't Infringe Apple Patents Last update: 7/9/2012 1:02:07 PM LONDON --Samsung Electronics Co (005930.SE) has won the latest skirmish in a broader patents war against Apple Inc. (AAPL) as the High Court of England and Wales ruled that three of Samsung's Galaxy touch-screen tablet products don't infringe Apple's patents. A High Court judge found in favor of Samsung in part because Samsung's tablets weren't as "cool" as those of Apple, something he said afficionados would immediately have recognized. The Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1, the Galaxy Tab 8.9, and the Galaxy Tab 7.7. are "different" from an Apple tablet design, and do not infringe Apple's patents, the High Court found. Judge Birss QC, in the ruling published Monday, cited examples of phone designs with similar features to Apple's products which predate the Apple versions. It also said the products of Apple and Samsung would be distinguishably different to informed users of tablets. "Samsung's tablets "do not have the same understated and extreme simplicity which is possessed by the Apple design," Judge Birss said in the ruling. "They are not as cool." Samsung said the judgement "affirms our position that our Galaxy Tab products do not infringe Apple's registered design right. As the ruling proves, the origins of Apple's registered design features can be found in numerous examples of prior art." Colin Fowler, a litigation specialist at law firm Rowse, described the case as "a notable victory for Samsung." "Whilst the iPad may have redefined the tablet segment, this case turned solely on the appearance of the iPad design versus the Samsung's tablets and the fact that there has been earlier tablet products with a similar appearance to the iPad design turned out to be 0users liked this posts0users disliked this posts Reply

Message.Title: UPDATE: Apple to Release Latest iPad in China
Message.Msg: Apple to release third-generation iPad in China July 20 Prices for Apple's third-generation iPad will range from $499 to $829, depending on memory capacity. An Apple device compatible with China Unicom's (CHU, 0762.HK, K3ID.SG) mobile network in May received a network access license, a regulatory website showed, suggesting Apple was close to being able to sell its new iPad in China. Apple sold 11.8 million iPad units in its most recent period, more than double from a year earlier. Apple began selling the third-generation iPad in March in the U.S., the first major product launch for Apple since the latest iPhone went on sale in October. Apple had said it sold a record 3 million iPads in the product's first weekend of sales.

Message.Title: Obama’s Brother Featured in Anti-Obama Document
Message.Msg: President Barack Obama's half-brother George is making his movie debut in a soon-to-be-released documentary, “2016,” which has been produced by a filmmaking partner of Steven Spielberg. The film bills itself as an inside look inside how Obama's past influences his policy making. "'2016 Obama's America' takes audiences on a gripping visual journey into the heart of the world’s most powerful office to reveal the struggle of whether one man's past will redefine America over the next four years. The film examines the question, 'If Obama wins a second term, where will we be in 2016?,' the film's website reads. Obama’s brother was the subject of news reports during the 2008 presidential campaign, when he was found to be living in a hut in a slum area of Haruma, Kenya. The president’s sibling now reportedly lives in Nairobi. George is the youngest of several children that Barack Obama, Sr. fathered with four separate wives. He shares the same father as the president, but not the same mother. The movie “2016” is produced by Gerald Molen, the Oscar-winning co-producer of “Schindler’s List,” “Jurassic Park,” “Rain Man,” and “Minority Report.” Molen also happens to be a filmmaking partner of famed director Spielberg.

Message.Title: Hispanic Voters 'Shopping Around'
Message.Msg: Hispanic voters are “shopping around” for new leadership because President Barack Obama has failed on the promises he made in the last election, conservative strategist Jennifer Korn tells Newsmax. “Hispanics voted for President Obama in the last election cycle because there were promises made,” Korn, executive director of the Hispanic Leadership Network, told Newsmax on Monday. “One, on immigration. He campaigned very hard on what he was going to do on immigration. And two, returning jobs and lowering unemployment. “He’s really failed on those fronts – and Hispanics are affected by that, and so they’re shopping around. They’re looking at the other options.” One clear option is presumptive GOP presidential candidate Mitt Romney, she said. “Romney has a window of opportunity to go in the community and really make a case for how he’s going to return jobs to the United States. And really that is the No. 1 issue.” Referencing the current 11 percent Hispanic unemployment rate, Korn added, “Just like all Americans, when you poll Hispanics, jobs and the economy are the No. 1 issues, and second and third are healthcare and education. Immigration doesn’t come until about fourth or fifth.”

Message.Title: Obama Is Losing the Catholic Vote
Message.Msg: President Barack Obama is antagonizing a historic part of the Democratic base — the Catholic vote — which makes up approximately 24 percent of the voting public. A national crisis is brewing, because deep in the fine print of the Affordable Care Law, better known as Obamacare, is a government attack on religious freedom. The Catholic Bishops of the United States called for rallies on June 8, 2012, in support of religious freedom, as set forth in the U.S. Constitution and as defended by President Franklin D. Roosevelt in his “Four Freedoms” speech featuring “Freedom of Worship.” Among the 160 Defend Religious Freedom interfaith rallies held nationwide, one took place at a major intersection in Sarasota, Fla. Under a hot Florida sun, some 900 people of many faiths gathered to hear speeches, sing patriotic and religious songs, and waive signs protesting President Obama’s “HHS mandate”. Some rally participants lined a busy intersection bordering the Bayfront Park where the rally took place. They waved printed and hand-lettered signs reading “Stop Obama’s HHS Mandate,” “Defend Religious Freedom,” and Hispanic demonstrators waved hand-painted signs that read, “Viva Cristo Rey.”

Message.Title: Price of AAPL stock price should double based on standard valuation
Message.Msg: ============================================= To compute the price AAPL should be today: ============================================= Step I: Compute PEG ratio = Divide FORWARD P/E by expected GROWTH RATE PCT. Growth 25% (assumption) P/E ratio 11.32 (forward P/E) PEG ratio = (11.32 / 25) = 0.45 Step II: Compute stock value = CURRENT STOCK PRICE / PEG RATIO + CASH PER SHARE Stock value = ((STOCK PRICE / PEG RATIO) + CASH) ((614.26 / 0.45) + 117.00) = $1482 Last year-over-year growth was 96% vs the 25% assumed in the above scenario. Earnings growth was 58.8%. Note: When IBM topped $1 billion market cap the pundits all screamed that no stock can stay over $1 billion. Note2: Now the pundits are making similar conclusions on AAPL.

Message.Title: Apple pulled out of EPEAT? What? True??? Federal Agencies can't buy Apple any longer? Please confirm. Big deal if true.
Message.Msg: US Federal Agencies No Longer Allowed to Buy Apple Products Published on: 7th Jul 2012 US federal government agencies are no longer able to purchase Apple products after the company withdrew from a mandatory certification scheme. The Electronic Product Environmental Assessment Tool (EPEAT) certification is required under a law passed in 2009 if a federal government agency is to buy goods or services from a company. It ensures that the products meet minimum environmental protection standards. In a statement on its website the agency said that Apple had notified the it that it will be withdrawing its products from the EPEAT registry and will no longer be submitting its products to EPEAT for environmental rating. In a statement, the agency said that "We regret that Apple will no longer be registering its products in EPEAT. We hope that they will decide to do so again at some point in future." It is not clear why Apple withdrew from the ratings service, especially as it cuts off sales to a fairly substantial customer - the US Government. One report by the iFixit blog suggested that the problem relates to the difficulty of repairing Apple products and stripping them down for recycling. Apple has struggled with its eco-friendly credentials, with repeated reports from agencies such as Greenpeace criticizing the company, not just for what they know the company is doing, but also for their apparent secrecy about the environmental impact of their various manufacturing processes.

Message.Title: This is huge!
Message.Msg: Smartphone growth in China is up 163% from last year. AND Apple's share of the market has gone from 9.9% to 17.3% share or up 74% in share of a pie that grew 163%. Let' look at that in detail. Say there were 100,000 smartphones sold in China in the June 2011 Q and Apple sold 9.9% of them or 9900 total iphones. This quarter the total phones sold has gone up 163% or to a total of 263,000 smartphones. Apple sold 17.3% of that number or 44,710 iphones = 352% increase in iphone sales. Interesting how these facts weren't extrapolated to the public.

Message.Title: BMO Capital forecast: Apple will miss...
Message.Msg: In a note to investors on Tuesday investment firm BMO Capital forecast Apple to post a significant miss for its fourth fiscal quarter of 2012 as Mac sales continue to be cannibalized by the company's popular iPad tablet line. Despite raising sales estimates for both the iPhone and iPad, BMO analyst Keith Bachman said the just-ended June quarter and upcoming final fiscal quarter of 2012 will be "challenging" for Apple as the tech giant moves into a new product cycle, reports Barron's. Apple could see a $5.5 billion miss from the $38.5 billion consensus for the company's fourth fiscal quarter ending in September if its third quarter performance is in line with the current $37.5 billion forecast, according to historical patterns and outlooks. Watch and learn!

Message.Title: San Francisco won't buy anymore Apple products...
Message.Msg: Apple’s Cupertino headquarters may just be a few miles away from San Francisco, but the city won’t be spending any more cash on its products. According to the Wall Street Journal, city agencies in San Francisco will no longer be able to purchase Apple products after the company asked the Electronic Product Environmental Assessment Tool (EPEAT) — the group that sets environmental standards for electronics — to remove all 39 of its products from the agency’s green registry. Many more cities will follow. Watch and learn!
